Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the ATSU router Initialization? (level 1)
Answers: For the Air-Ground communications functions and services of the ATSU to be activated.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of VHF3 Link test? (level 1)
Answers: To confirms that the communication link between VHF3 and the ground is operational.
To confirms that the communication link between VHF3 and the RMP is operational
To confirms that the communication link between VHF3 and the ATSU is operational

Questions.QuestionString: The ACARS STBY memo message on ECAM go off when: (level 1)
Answers: The initialization of the ATSU router is completed.

Questions.QuestionString: What are the parameters required for ATSU router initialization? (level 3)
Answers: The A/C Registration Number, airline ident parameter and Scan Mask validation.

Questions.QuestionString: Routing data to and from AOC is the function of: (level 1)
Answers: Remote AOC applications or hosted AOC applications

Questions.QuestionString: What is/are warnings if there is an ATSU failure? (level 3)
Answers: A message “COM ACARS FAULT” on EWD, aural warning and master light on.
A message “COM ACARS FAULT” on EWD, aural warning and master light on and a SD page is called
A message “COM ACARS FAULT” on EWD only.

Questions.QuestionString: MSG “company data link standby” green memo displayed on the ECAM means (level 3)
Answers: Initialization of the ATSU Router needs to be done
ATSU is powered but not working

Questions.QuestionString: What is the main computer of ITIMS. (level 1)
Which computer does ITIMS use to transfer data? (level 1)
The test function of the maintenance menu is used to: (level 2)
Answers: Test the link between the communication media and the ground.
Print out exchanged messages per media and router depending on selection.

Questions.QuestionString: What is corrected statement? (level 3)
Answers: The AOC MENU can be customized and gives access to the hosted AOC applications loaded in the ATSU.
The CONFIG function gives access to a SYSTEM CONFIG page to verify that the correct AOC software (S/W) and data base Seri Number (SN) have been successfully loaded into the ATSU.

Questions.QuestionString: ATIMS use VHF3 for: (level 2)
Answers: both data mode and voice mode

Questions.QuestionString: What does AOC stand for? (level 2)
What does ACARS STBY green memo displayed on the ECAM mean? (level 2)
Answers: Initialization of the ATSU Router needs to be done
ATSU is powered but not working

Questions.QuestionString: What is the air / ground communication media of ATIMS? (level 1)
When the OPS frequency is activated (132.225 given as an example), the ATSU controls the VHF3 frequency in VOICE mode. On the Radio Management Panel (RMP): (level 3)
Answers: the ACARS indication stays in view in the active window.
the number 132.225 indication stays in view in the active window.
the ACARS indication stays in view in the standby window.

Questions.QuestionString: Where can you test the VHF3 link? (level 2)
The A/C interface/ Host platform software is composed of: (level 3)
Answers: air/ ground communication, used for the management of air/ground communication media.

Questions.QuestionString: Which is component used for uploading ATSU software? (level 1)
Answers: MDDU in case of MCDU1 has failed.

Questions.QuestionString: When there is an ATSU failure (if ATSU is installed): (level 2)
Answers: the message DATA LINK ATSU FAULT
the message COMM ACARS FAULT and master caution lights come on.

Questions.QuestionString: The RMPs sends and receives signal to/from the ATSU by: (level 2)
What are the parameters required when initialize the ATSU router (level 2)
Answers: The A/C Registration Number, airline ident parameter and Scan Mask validation.

Questions.QuestionString: The ATSU Software are included: (level 1)
What is AOC applications ? (level 2)
Answers: It is communication services between the aircraft and the airline facility
It is data communication services between the aircraft and the airline facility
It is data communication services between the aircraft and the ATC ground station.

Questions.QuestionString: What does Scan Mask do ? (level 1)
Answers: To select and activate the VHF service providers contracted by the airline.
To scan and tune VHF frequency available

Questions.QuestionString: The ATSU automatically controls data frequencies in the order defined in: (level 2)
To carry out initialization of the Air Traffic Service Unit (ATSU) router: (level 3)
Answers: The A/C registration number must be must be entered.
The A/C registration number is sent by the CFDIU.
No need A/C registration number information.

Questions.QuestionString: Right memo "ACARS CALL" appears in green when: (level 2)
Answers: A call request message from ground is received.
A call request from Cabin attendant.
A call request from Forward attendant Panel.

Questions.QuestionString: The MAINTENANCE menu is composed of: (level 3)
Answers: TEST, which is used to test the link between the communication media (VHF3, SATCOM and HF if installed) and the ground,
STATISTICS used for media and router statistics: number of up linked messages, number of down linked messages.

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer is a center of information system ? (level 1)
Which function is belong to ATSU ? (level 1)
How does the ATSU load software ? (level 1)
Which menu of ATSU does the pilot get weather information ? (level 1)
Which menu of ATSU can we do the datalink test of ATSU ? (level 1)
Which VHF system does the ATSU use to transport data ? (level 1)
Which procedure do we must perform when install new ATSU ? (level 2)
Answers: Initialization procedure of the ATSU router

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer interface with ATSU ? (level 2)
You can access to ATSU via: (level 2)
ATSU DATA LINK menu consists of: (level 3)
The ATSU software is partitioned into main parts: (level 2)
Answers: Aircraft interface and data link application

Questions.QuestionString: When there is an text AOC message, a message displays on ECAM, that is: (level 1)
When the right memo “VHF3 VOICE” appears in green that means: (level 3)
Answers: VDR3 is not available for data transmission

Questions.QuestionString: Which softwares following require to be loaded when install an ATSU? (level 2)
Answers: ATSU interface & ATSU config & ATSU router parameter & AOC
ATSU interface & ATSU router parameter & ATSU config & AOC softwares
ATSU interface & ATSU config are enough

Questions.QuestionString: The Air Traffic and Information Management System (ATIMS) for the pre-FANS configuration mainly consists of an: (level 3)
Answers: Air Traffic Services Unit (ATSU), which allows ACARS functionalities.
ACARS, which allows Air Traffic Services Unit (ATSU) functionalities.
ATC transponder, which allows ACARS functionalities.

Questions.QuestionString: Hosted AOC applications (level 2)
Answers: Only routes data to and from AOC peripherals.
Depend on airline definition and uploaded into the ATSU.
Receive ground messages and route them to the right AOC peripheral.

Questions.QuestionString: Concerning Initialization of the ATSU Router (level 3)
Answers: The ATSU creates the airline ident by concatenating the flight ident parameter and the flight number parameter coming from the FMS.
The airline ident is not available and must be entered.
airline ident is sent by the CFDIU.

Questions.QuestionString: The ATSU software is partitioned into two main parts: (level 2)
Answers: Aircraft interface / host platform and Data link applications.
Aircraft interface / host platform and hardware.

Questions.QuestionString: The VHF scan mask gives: (level 2)
Answers: AOC software and data base part number and the ATSU AOC identification.
an ordered list of service providers usable for VHF data communications.
an list of tests for maintenance of VHF3 comunication.

Questions.QuestionString: After an ATSU removal/installation some tasks have to be performed (level 3)
Answers: The A/C Interface software must be loaded into the ATSU, an ATSU router initialization, the AOC software and database must be loaded into the ATSU and BITE test of the ATIMS.
an ATSU router initialization and BITE test of the ATIMS.

Questions.QuestionString: Memo message DATALINK COMPANY STBY comes on ECAM means? (level 1)
The initialization (through COMM INIT menu) is considered as completed when the ATSU has received (level 3)
Answers: a SELCAL code, Airline Ident and scan mask.
a Flight Number , Airline Ident and scan mask.
a valid Aircraft Registration Number (ARN), Airline Ident and scan mask.

Questions.QuestionString: The Air Traffic and Information Management System (ATIMS) mainly consists of? (level 3)
Answers: An Air Traffic Services Unit (ATSU), which allows ACARS functionalities.

Questions.QuestionString: How are the Air-Ground communications managed by the ATSU communication function? (level 3)
Answers: Pilots choose appropriate Menu in MCDU
They may be either automatically or manually handled using MCDU pages and/or RMPs.

Questions.QuestionString: After ATSU router initialization, which parameter can be changed? (level 3)
When can we use VHF3 in voice mode? (level 2)
Answers: VHF 1 or VHF 2 failure or COMPANY CALL

Questions.QuestionString: If A/L Id is accidentally wrong entried? (level 3)
Answers: A/l Id is always selected automatically
A/L Id can be re-selected manually
ATSU must be re-installed all softwares

Questions.QuestionString: What is purpose of the ATSU router initialization? (level 3)
Answers: For air/ground communications functions and service of the ATSU activated

Questions.QuestionString: The Air-Ground communications are managed by the ATSU? (level 3)
Answers: manually using MCDU pages and/or ACPs
automatically without pilot action or manually using MCDU pages and/or RMPs

Questions.QuestionString: What are downlink messages? (level 3)
Answers: Aircraft to ground messages (downlink) comprise maintenance, monitoring, operational, performance and cabin data
contain requests for transmission of specific downlink reports

Questions.QuestionString: Remote AOC applications(Level 3)
Answers: Receive ground messages and route them to the right AOC peripheral.

Questions.QuestionString: If a complete S/W uploading is required, which action can be made(Level 3)
Answers: active "ATSU installed" pin programming on the FWC
active "ATSU installed" pin programming on VHF 3 transceiver

Questions.QuestionString: The MCDU gives the following functions: (Level 3)
Answers: Airline Operational Control (AOC) hosted applications management and air-ground communication management.
Airline Operational Control (AOC) remote applications management and air-ground communication management.

Questions.QuestionString: Which page gives an ordered list of authorized service providers usable for data communications(Level 2)
Which menu is used to customized and gives access to the AOC applications loaded in the ATSU(Level 2)
Before Initialization of the ATSU Router is completed, which memo is display on upper ECAM(Level 3)
Answers: ACARS STBY or COMPANY DATALINK STBY.

Questions.QuestionString: Three essential parameters are required for Initialization of the ATSU Router (Level 3)
Answers: a SELCAL code, Airline Ident and scan mask.
a Flight Number , Airline Ident and scan mask.
a valid Aircraft Registration Number (ARN), flight ident and scan mask.

Questions.QuestionString: Which action must be done to the COMPANY DATALINK STBY green memo is displayed instead of the ACARS STBY memo (Level 3)
Answers: active “ATSU installed" pin programming on the FWC
active “ATSU installed" pin programming on the SDAC
active “ATSU installed" pin programming on the ATSU

Questions.QuestionString: Which menu is used for Air-Ground communication management (Level 3)
AOC software and data base part number and the ATSU AOC identification are showed on: (Level 3)
The ATSU is interfaced with MCDUs for (Level 3)
